Query BuilderÔÉÅ

This module provides functionalities for exporting data in synchronous contexts.

class DbUnify.SQLite3.QueryBuilder.QueryBuilder[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

alter_table(table: str, commands: List[str]) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL ALTER TABLE clause.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to be altered.

  • commands ‚Äì List of commands to modify the table structure (e.g., adding or dropping columns).

Returns:

SQL ALTER TABLE clause as a string.

create_table(table: str, **columns: str) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL CREATE TABLE clause.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to be created.

  • columns ‚Äì Column definitions, where keys are column names and values are data types.

Returns:

SQL CREATE TABLE clause as a string.

Example: >>> qb = QueryBuilder() >>> qb.create_table( ‚Ä¶ table=‚Äôproducts‚Äô, ‚Ä¶ id=‚ÄôINTEGER PRIMARY KEY‚Äô, ‚Ä¶ name=‚ÄôTEXT NOT NULL‚Äô, ‚Ä¶ price=‚ÄôREAL‚Äô, ‚Ä¶ stock=‚ÄôINTEGER DEFAULT 0‚Äô ‚Ä¶ ) ‚ÄòCREATE TABLE products (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT NOT NULL, price REAL, stock INTEGER DEFAULT 0)‚Äô

Constructs a SQL DELETE FROM clause.

Parameters:

table ‚Äì Name of the table to delete from.

Returns:

SQL DELETE FROM clause as a string.

delete_where(*conditions: str) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL WHERE clause for deletion.

Parameters:

conditions ‚Äì Conditions to be used in the WHERE clause.

Returns:

SQL WHERE clause for deletion as a string.

Example: >>> qb = QueryBuilder() >>> qb.delete_where(‚Äòage < 18‚Äô) ‚ÄòWHERE age < 18‚Äô

Constructs a SQL DROP TABLE clause.

Parameters:

table ‚Äì Name of the table to be dropped.

Returns:

SQL DROP TABLE clause as a string.

Constructs a SQL EXISTS clause to check for the existence of rows returned by a subquery.

Parameters:

subquery ‚Äì SQL query to be checked for existence.

Returns:

SQL EXISTS clause as a string.

Constructs a SQL FROM clause.

Parameters:

table ‚Äì Name of the table to select from.

Returns:

SQL FROM clause as a string.

get_delete_query(table: str, conditions: List[str] | None = None) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a complete SQL DELETE query.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to delete from.

  • conditions ‚Äì List of WHERE conditions to be applied.

Returns:

Complete SQL DELETE query as a string.

get_insert_query(table: str, **values: str | int | float | bool) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a complete SQL INSERT query.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to insert into.

  • values ‚Äì Column-value pairs to be inserted.

Returns:

Complete SQL INSERT query as a string.

get_select_query(table: str, columns: List[str] | None = None, joins: List[str] | None = None, conditions: List[str] | None = None, group_by: List[str] | None = None, having: List[str] | None = None, order_by: List[str] | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a complete SQL SELECT query.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to select from.

  • columns ‚Äì List of columns to select. If None, all columns are selected.

  • joins ‚Äì List of JOIN clauses to be added to the query.

  • conditions ‚Äì List of WHERE conditions to be applied.

  • group_by ‚Äì List of columns to group by.

  • having ‚Äì List of HAVING conditions.

  • order_by ‚Äì List of columns to order by, with optional sorting direction.

  • limit ‚Äì Number of rows to return.

  • offset ‚Äì Number of rows to skip before starting to return rows.

Returns:

Complete SQL SELECT query as a string.

get_update_query(table: str, values: Dict[str, str | int | float | bool], conditions: List[str] | None = None) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a complete SQL UPDATE query.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to update.

  • values ‚Äì Column-value pairs to be updated.

  • conditions ‚Äì List of WHERE conditions to be applied.

Returns:

Complete SQL UPDATE query as a string.

Constructs a SQL GROUP BY clause.

columns ‚Äì Columns to group by.

SQL GROUP BY clause as a string.

join(table: str, on_condition: str, join_type: str = 'INNER') → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL JOIN clause.

Parameters:

  • table ‚Äì Name of the table to join.

  • on_condition ‚Äì ON condition for the join.

  • join_type ‚Äì Type of join (e.g., ‚ÄòINNER‚Äô, ‚ÄòLEFT‚Äô, ‚ÄòRIGHT‚Äô). Defaults to ‚ÄòINNER‚Äô.

Returns:

SQL JOIN clause as a string.

limit(limit: int | None = None) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL LIMIT clause.

Parameters:

limit ‚Äì Maximum number of rows to return.

Returns:

SQL LIMIT clause as a string.

Constructs a SQL OFFSET clause.

Parameters:

offset ‚Äì Number of rows to skip before starting to return rows.

Returns:

SQL OFFSET clause as a string.

order_by(*columns: str) → str[source]ÔÉÅ

Constructs a SQL ORDER BY clause.

Parameters:

columns ‚Äì Columns to order by, with optional sorting direction (e.g., ‚ÄòASC‚Äô, ‚ÄòDESC‚Äô).

Returns:

SQL ORDER BY clause as a string.

Constructs a SQL SELECT clause.

Parameters:

columns ‚Äì Column names to be selected. If empty, ‚Äò*‚Äô is used to select all columns.

Returns:

SQL SELECT clause as a string.

values ‚Äì Column-value pairs to be updated.

query ‚Äì SQL query to be wrapped as a subquery.

table ‚Äì Name of the table to be truncated.

Constructs a SQL UNION clause to combine the results of multiple SELECT queries.

Parameters:

queries ‚Äì SQL SELECT queries to be combined with UNION.

Constructs a SQL WHERE clause.

conditions ‚Äì Conditions to be used in the WHERE clause.

SQL WHERE clause as a string.

The QueryBuilder class provides functionalities to construct SQL queries. Below are examples of how to use each method in the QueryBuilder class.

Class Initialization

First, import the necessary module and initialize the QueryBuilder class.

from DbUnify.SQLite3.QueryBuilder import QueryBuilder

qb = QueryBuilder()

Method Examples

1. `alter_table`

Constructs a SQL ALTER TABLE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.alter_table(
    table='employees',
    commands=[
        'ADD COLUMN salary REAL',
        'DROP COLUMN old_position'
    ]
)
print(sql)

ALTER TABLE employees ADD COLUMN salary REAL, DROP COLUMN old_position

2. `create_table`

Constructs a SQL CREATE TABLE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.create_table(
    table='products',
    id='INTEGER PRIMARY KEY',
    name='TEXT NOT NULL',
    price='REAL',
    stock='INTEGER DEFAULT 0'
)
print(sql)

CREATE TABLE products (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT NOT NULL, price REAL, stock INTEGER DEFAULT 0)

3. `delete_from`

Constructs a SQL DELETE FROM clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.delete_from(table='employees')
print(sql)

DELETE FROM employees

4. `delete_where`

Constructs a SQL WHERE clause for deletion.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.delete_where('age < 18')
print(sql)

WHERE age < 18

5. `drop_table`

Constructs a SQL DROP TABLE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.drop_table(table='old_data')
print(sql)

DROP TABLE old_data

6. `exists`

Constructs a SQL EXISTS clause to check for the existence of rows returned by a subquery.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.exists(subquery='SELECT 1 FROM employees WHERE id = 1')
print(sql)

EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM employees WHERE id = 1)

7. `from_table`

Constructs a SQL FROM clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.from_table(table='employees')
print(sql)

FROM employees

8. `get_delete_query`

Constructs a complete SQL DELETE query.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.get_delete_query(
    table='employees',
    conditions=['age < 18']
)
print(sql)

DELETE FROM employees WHERE age < 18

9. `get_insert_query`

Constructs a complete SQL INSERT query.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.get_insert_query(
    table='employees',
    name='John Doe',
    age=30,
    department='HR'
)
print(sql)

INSERT INTO employees (name, age, department) VALUES ('John Doe', 30, 'HR')

10. `get_select_query`

Constructs a complete SQL SELECT query.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.get_select_query(
    table='employees',
    columns=['name', 'age'],
    conditions=['age > 30'],
    order_by=['name DESC'],
    limit=10
)
print(sql)

SELECT name, age FROM employees WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 10

11. `get_update_query`

Constructs a complete SQL UPDATE query.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.get_update_query(
    table='employees',
    values={'department': 'Sales'},
    conditions=['id = 1']
)
print(sql)

UPDATE employees SET department = 'Sales' WHERE id = 1

12. `group_by`

Constructs a SQL GROUP BY clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.group_by('department')
print(sql)

GROUP BY department

13. `having`

Constructs a SQL HAVING clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.having('COUNT(*) > 5')
print(sql)

HAVING COUNT(*) > 5

14. `insert_into`

Constructs a SQL INSERT INTO clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.insert_into(table='employees')
print(sql)

INSERT INTO employees

15. `join`

Constructs a SQL JOIN clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.join(table='departments', on_condition='employees.department_id = departments.id', join_type='LEFT')
print(sql)

LEFT JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.id

16. `limit`

Constructs a SQL LIMIT clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.limit(limit=5)
print(sql)

LIMIT 5

17. `offset`

Constructs a SQL OFFSET clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.offset(offset=10)
print(sql)

OFFSET 10

18. `order_by`

Constructs a SQL ORDER BY clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.order_by('age DESC', 'name ASC')
print(sql)

ORDER BY age DESC, name ASC

19. `select`

Constructs a SQL SELECT clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.select('name', 'age')
print(sql)

SELECT name, age

20. `set`

Constructs a SQL SET clause for updating rows.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.set(name='Jane Doe', age=32)
print(sql)

SET name = 'Jane Doe', age = 32

21. `subquery`

Wraps a query in parentheses to be used as a subquery.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.subquery('SELECT * FROM employees WHERE age > 30')
print(sql)

(SELECT * FROM employees WHERE age > 30)

22. `truncate_table`

Constructs a SQL TRUNCATE TABLE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.truncate_table(table='old_records')
print(sql)

TRUNCATE TABLE old_records

23. `union`

Constructs a SQL UNION clause to combine the results of multiple SELECT queries.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.union(
    'SELECT name FROM employees WHERE department = "HR"',
    'SELECT name FROM contractors WHERE department = "HR"'
)
print(sql)

SELECT name FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR' UNION SELECT name FROM contractors WHERE department = 'HR'

24. `update`

Constructs a SQL UPDATE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.update(table='employees')
print(sql)

UPDATE employees

25. `values`

Constructs a SQL VALUES clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.values(name='Alice', age=29)
print(sql)

VALUES (name = 'Alice', age = 29)

26. `where`

Constructs a SQL WHERE clause.

qb = QueryBuilder()
sql = qb.where('age > 30', 'department = "Sales"')
print(sql)

WHERE age > 30 AND department = 'Sales'
